Wait, but how to reverse a string in Fortran? We can write a function to reverse a string:

function reverse_string(s) result(rev_s)

   character(len=*), intent(in) :: s

   character(len=len_trim(s)) :: rev_s

   integer :: i, len_s

   len_s = len_trim(s)

   do i = 1, len_s

      rev_s(i:i) = s(len_s - i + 1:len_s - i + 1)

   end do

end function

end do

function reverse_string(s) result(rev_s)

   character(len=*), intent(in) :: s

   character(len=len_trim(s)) :: rev_s

   integer :: i, len_s

   len_s = len_trim(s)

   do i = 1, len_s

      rev_s(i:i) = s(len_s - i + 1:len_s - i + 1)

   end do

   implicit none

   integer(8) :: N, c, i, next_i, x, next_str_len, j, k

   character(len=20) :: s, temp_str, next_str

   logical :: has3, has5, has7, f

      has5 = .false.

      has7 = .false.

         case ('3')

            has3 = .true.

         case ('5')

            has5 = .true.

         case ('7')

            has7 = .true.

         end select

      end do

      if (has3 .and. has5 .and. has7) then

         c = c +1

      end if

      ! Compute next_i

      temp_str = ''

      f = .false.

      do j = len_trim(s), 1, -1

         character(len=1) :: a

            else if (a == '5') then

program main

   implicit none

   integer(8) :: N, c, i, next_i, x

   character(len=20) :: s, temp_str, next_str

   logical :: has3, has5, has7, f

   integer :: loop_i

   real :: sqrt_num

   logical :: is_prime

   ! First part: compute c

   read(*,*) N

   c = 0

   i = 357_8

   do while (i <= N)

      ! Convert i to string s

      write(s, '(I20)') i

      s = adjustl(s)

      ! Check if contains 3,5,7

      has3 = .false.

      has5 = .false.

      has7 = .false.

      do j = 1, len_trim(s)

         select case (s(j:j))

         case ('3')

            has3 = .true.

         case ('5')

            has5 = .true.

         case ('7')

            has7 = .true.

         end select

      end do

      if (has3 .and. has5 .and. has7) then

         c = c +1

      end if

      ! Compute next_i

      temp_str = ''

      f = .false.

      do j = len_trim(s), 1, -1

         character(len=1) :: a

         a = s(j:j)

         if (.not. f) then

            if (a == '3') then

               temp_str = trim(temp_str) // '5'

               f = .true.

            else if (a == '5') then

               temp_str = trim(temp_str) // '7'

               f = .true.

            else

               temp_str = trim(temp_str) // '3'

            end if

         else

            temp_str = trim(temp_str) // a

         end if

      end do

      if (.not. f) then

         temp_str = trim(temp_str) // '3'

      end if

      ! Reverse temp_str to get next_str

      next_str = ''

      do k = len_trim(temp_str), 1, -1

         next_str = trim(next_str) // temp_str(k:k)

      end do

      ! Convert next_str to next_i

      read(next_str, *) next_i

      i = next_i

   end do

   ! Second part: compute next prime starting from c

   x = c

   if (x /= 2 .and. mod(x,2) ==0) then

      x = x +1

   end if

   do while (.true.)

      sqrt_num = sqrt(real(x,8))

      is_prime = .true.

      do loop_i = 3, int(sqrt_num), 2

         if (mod(x,loop_i) ==0) then

            is_prime = .false.

            exit

         end if

      end do

      if (is_prime) then

         exit

      else

         x = x +2

      end if

   end do

   print *, x

end program main
